ReportSection.name: Research Project
ReportSection.title: Section 2 - Information about Applicant’s Research Project
ReportSection.ReportItem:
Scientific Title of Research Project

{$item}

Keywords

Please provide up to a maximum of five (5) specific keywords or descriptive technical terms or methodologies that best describe the research – e.g. Medline Headings. {$item}

Lay Summary

Provide a non-confidential summary in lay terms of your research project. Ongoing feedback from lay members of our committees, patients and their families and support systems, indicates the importance of succinct, plain language descriptions of research, particularly in mobilizing research findings. We are looking for a brief description of the research, why you are conducting the research and how it may impact health care for frail older Canadians. The summary should be written at a ninth-grade reading level (Flesch-Kinkaid scale). (Note: This summary will be evaluated by lay and scientific reviewers. For funded applicants, this summary may be used in media releases, communications and posted on the CFN website.) {$item}

Scientific Summary

Provide a non-confidential scientific summary of your research project, highlighting the hypothesis, project objectives, milestones and deliverables, and potential socioeconomic impact. (Note: This summary will be evaluated by lay and scientific reviewers. For funded applicants, this summary may be used in media releases, communications and posted on the CFN website.) {$item}

Background and Research Question(s)

State the research question(s). Clearly articulate the context, population and intervention. Provide a review of the literature that identifies the knowledge gap or rationale for the research. Where applicable, clearly state the underlying hypothesis. {$item}

Methodological Approach

Describe the methodological research approach, including study design, data collection, analysis plan, etc. {$item}

Project Relevance and Impact

Describe why you feel the work you plan to carry out is important. Specifically, describe the relevance of your proposal to CFN strategic priorities and the fellowship program goals. Identify how this project will improve the care of frail older adults and support their families and caregivers. {$item}

ReportItem.descriptions: I expect that this research will require an ethics review.|I do not expect that this research will require an ethics review.

ReportSection.ReportItem:
Research Ethics

If your research project involves biohazards, humans, human embryonic stem cells or animals, and you are selected for funding from CFN, certification of approval by the host institution certification committee must be obtained by your supervisor before funds will be released. {$item}

Environmental Assessment

Does any phase or part of the research project
  1. take place outside an office or laboratory, or
  2. involve an undertaking as described in part 1 of Appendix B of the Natural Science and Engineering Research Council of Canada (NSERC) Form 101?
 {$item} If you answered yes to this question, and you are selected for the fellowship program, your supervisor will be required to complete an Environmental Assessment Impact Statement and the Canadian Environmental Assessment Act Pre-Screening Checklist for review and approval by CFN before funds will be released
